title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.3 ADOLESCENT HEALTH

description.narrative: Output 1.3 By 2025, the Government and stakeholders at national and subnational level will have increased capacity to expand and sustainably provide a package of quality services for adolescent boys and girls, including programmes that aim at preventing HIV, establishing healthy lifestyle behaviours and diets, and reducing harmful exposures and risk-taking, in development and humanitarian situations, and urban settings, which contributes to Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1.By 2025, new-borns, children and adolescent boys and girls, especially the most disadvantaged and those living in humanitarian situations, have increased access to and use of quality integrated health, nutrition, HIV and early stimulation services and benefit from a more nurturing, protective and clean environment

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Adolescent health and wellbeing (including sexual and reproductive health)
HIV - Emergency preparedness and response including Post exposure prophylaxis and risk informed conflict sensitive HIV programming
HIV service access and quality improvement through system strengthening at facility and community levels
HIV testing and counselling including EID, POC EID, PITC, ANC testing, Self testing, Retesting and Family based testing
Technical Assistance - Child and Adolescent Health and Wellbeing

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.3 By 2025, the Government and stakeholders at national and subnational level will have increased capacity to expand andsustainably provide a package of quality services for adolescent boys and girls, including programmes that aim at preventing HIV,establishing healthy lifestyle behaviours and diets, and reducing harmful exposures and risk-taking, in development andhumanitarian situations, and urban settings

description.narrative: The Adolescent Health and Wellbeing (AHWB) output attained 75% of the 2021 AWP results. Progress is attributed to concerted efforts to develop an enabling policy and resource environment for AHWB and, fostering of cross-sectoral and multi-sectoral programming, which is premised on health systems strengthening and the use of evidence and age-disaggregated data at national and sub-national level.Despite the 2021 COVID-19 resurgence, UNICEF provided support for MoH-led evidence generation, guidance dissemination, quality assurance, continuation of essential services, and Communication for Development to improve demand and positive behaviour. Resource mobilization and leveraging of existing resources and partnerships were optimized. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2022
